Data: Santner to Warner, no run slides a short ball across the batsman, cut away but straight to point

Santner to Warner, FOUR runs just short of Neesham at short third man. Too full for the cut, Warner still went through with it and managed to get a thick edge that raced past the man there for a boundary
Santner to Warner, no run gets to the pitch of the ball and hammers it straight to Williamson at cover
Santner to Warner, no run this is much better, slower through the air and lands it at length on middle, Warner stretches forward and blocks
Santner to Warner, no run flatter one on middle and leg, worked with the spin to midwicket
Santner to Warner, 1 run worked off his hip to square leg. Warner's just played a series of dots. Wow
Southee to Warner, 1 run
Southee to Finch, 1 run length ball that slides into middle and leg, worked to mid-on as they sneak in a single. Warner trusted his partner's call and took off in a jiffy
Southee to Warner, 1 run digs a short ball into the body, not alarming bounce, neither was the pace that threatening. Warner gets on top of the bounce and deflects it wide of square leg
Southee to Finch, 1 run half-volley on the pads, flicked with the angle to deep fine leg. The fielder there didn't have to move an inch
Southee to Warner, no run back of length delivery on off stump, he hops back and bunts it to short cover

Southee to Warner, FOUR runs superb hand-eye coordination. Picks the length so early. Stayed back in the crease, waited for it and flayed it behind point. Those wrists. Superb. Square third man was a mere spectator.
Santner to Finch, 1 wide drifts this back into middle and leg, Finch attempts a sweep and manages a glove. The keeper fluffs a relatively simple chance. Wide called
Santner to Finch, no run tossed up on middle, he gets forward and pats it to the off side

Santner to Finch, OUT so the dropped chance didn't cost them much. Finch looks to play a predetermined sweep. Was across a long way even before the ball was delivered, so he was in no position to sweep that full delivery. He swung through way too early as well as the ball sneaked through to crash into
Santner to Smith, no run some purchase off the pitch. This one turn's away from off stump, but Smith is half forward as he defends
Santner to Smith, 1 run worked off his hip to deep square and gets off the mark
Santner to Warner, no run steps out but can't get to the pitch of the ball, dabbed back down the pitch
Santner to Warner, 1 run worked with the spin to long-on for an easy single
Southee to Warner, 1 run length ball angling away, bunted wide of cover
Southee to Smith, no run short of length delivery around the sixth stump outside off, Smith watches it through to the keeper
Southee to Smith, FOUR runs delightful straight drive. Too full and the confidence from the first ODI speaks. He shuffles across just a touch and drills it down the ground past mid-on. Super timing
Southee to Smith, no run gets across and squeezes this full delivery to Williamson at cover
Southee to Smith, no run this is too full, he doesn't get underneath it. Jams his bat down to keep that out though
Southee to Smith, 1 run excellent stop by the skipper. Throws himself to his left to pull off a one-handed stop. That was travelling, saved three runs.
Santner to Smith, 1 run drifting into middle and leg, worked off his hip past square leg
Santner to Warner, no run gets across and wrists that one to midwicket
Santner to Warner, 1 run flighted over his eye line on middle, Warner eases it back past the bowler as they jog the single
Santner to Smith, no run this is fired full on middle from around the stumps, he stretches forward and blocks
Santner to Smith, 1 run makes a bit of room and punches that in-drifter to long-off
Santner to Warner, 1 run solid wrist work again as he eases it to wide long-on for an easy single to keep strike. Sensible stuff
Southee to Warner, 1 run full delivery angling away, squeezed between cover and point
Southee to Smith, no run this one nips away off the seam from length outside off, left alone
Southee to Smith, no run hops across to punch it into the gap at point, but this one jags back in to hit the inside edge and roll to the leg side
Southee to Smith, no run this is superb from Southee. This one's pitched up. The ball deviates away a wee bit, and Smith watches it through to the keeper
Southee to Smith, no run shapes to cut but realises the ball's too full for him to slash, lets it go instead
Southee to Smith, 1 run gets half-forward and bunts it towards cover, which is a little deep, and they get a single easily
Santner to Smith, 1 run eased with the spin to long-off, too full from Santner on that occasion
Santner to Warner, no run steps out but this one drifts away to beat the flick and hit him on the right thigh. Excellent from Santner. That's more like it.
Santner to Warner, no run gets to the pitch of the ball and dabs a tossed up delivery back down to the bowler
Santner to Warner, no run quicker one on middle and leg, tucked to square leg
Santner to Warner, 1 run slow turn back in, Warner was standing outside leg in anticipation of a full ball, just works it wide of square leg this time
Santner to Smith, no run shaped to drive but ended up defending solidly once he realised he was beaten in flight
Southee to Warner, no run low full toss, Warner could have actually swung across but instead waits and waits for it and ends up nearly yorking himself as he digs that out
Southee to Warner, no run mistimes an attempted drive to short cover. Pressure building? This has been an excellent comeback. Warner's timing has suddenly gone awry
Southee to Warner, 1 run once again no control whatsoever with that pull, just lobbed past the vacant square leg region
Southee to Smith, no run the ball stops on him a touch as he looks to drive firmly, gets a thick inside edge back to the bowler
Southee to Smith, 1 run punched to Williamson's right at cover, they manage to pinch a run
Southee to Warner, no run check-drives to cover. This one's bowled at length, once again looked like the ball stopped on him a touch
Santner to Smith, 1 run eased with the spin to long-off as they jog the single

Santner to Warner, FOUR runs sweeps and gets a bottom edge which is enough to beat short fine leg. Half-century for him, not a typically robust innings but he'll still take it. Coming back to the fielding effort, it could have been a better one from Trent Boult. Shouldn't have been more than two.
Santner to Warner, 1 run worked wide of short fine leg
Santner to Smith, 2 runs short and wide, he rocks back and cracks it into the gap at deep point
Santner to Smith, no run gives it generous amount of flight on off, Smith gets forward and blocks
Santner to Smith, 1 run drifts in from wide of the crease, Smith bunts it to mid-off, where a misfield allows a single that shouldn't have been
de Grandhomme to Smith, no run floats a length ball on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
de Grandhomme to Smith, no run driven firmly to mid-on, tight line on middle
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run gets across and whips it to deep midwicket. Smith's get-off-strike shot, says Mark Taylor.
de Grandhomme to Warner, no run angles a full delivery in from around the stumps, pushed to cover. Calls 'no' immediately
de Grandhomme to Warner, 1 run hint of width, punched to sweeper cover
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run angles a length ball into middle and leg, worked wide of midwicket as they jog the single
Santner to Smith, no run nicely tossed up, shuffles across and glances to short fine leg
Santner to Smith, 1 run flatter on middle and leg, hangs back and works the ball through square leg
Santner to Warner, 1 run just short of a good length on middle stump, Warner steps outside leg and cuts out to sweeper cover. Brings up Australia's 100
Santner to Smith, 1 run Santner runs this length ball into Smith, who shuffles across and tucks around the corner
Santner to Warner, 1 run flatter and angled across, drills a drive to sweeper
Santner to Smith, 1 run non-turning length ball on off, dabbed towards midwicket for another single
de Grandhomme to Smith, 2 runs back of a length and outside off, shuffles across and bunts it through square leg
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run flicked away through square leg
de Grandhomme to Warner, no run short and angled in on off from around the wicket, Warner camps back and fends it back to de Grandhomme
de Grandhomme to Warner, 1 run full and outside off, opens the face and glides the ball to point, where Guptill fumbles. NZ's fielding has been sloppy again
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run just short of a good length and angled in, glanced behind square
de Grandhomme to Warner, 1 run shortish and outside off, steered square through the off side
Santner to Warner, 2 runs flatter and quicker on middle and leg, hangs back and whips through midwicket
Santner to Warner, 1 run Santner gives this more air, the line is on middle, smoothly driven down to long-on
Santner to Smith, no run tossed full on middle, played back to the bowler
Santner to Smith, no run back of a length and slides in, back-foot punch back to Santner
Santner to Smith, no run slower through the air, Santner held this back, hint of turn. Blocked to cover on the front foot
Santner to Smith, no run looped up around off, opens the face, and dabs it to extra cover. Smith is ready to chance a single, is isn't there, and Warner rightly sends his captain back
Henry to Warner, 2 runs and Warner greets him with a lofted hit or rather a sliced hit. Full and wide outside off, drops to one knee, and toe-ends the ball over extra cover
Henry to Warner, 1 run back of a length on middle, worked deftly to the left of mid-on
Henry to Smith, FOUR runs short and outside off from over the wicket, hip-high ball, 133.1ks, Smith has ample time to swat-pull it away to the right of diving midwicket
Henry to Smith, 1 run full and outside off, walks across, and flicks to midwicket
Henry to Warner, 1 run just short of a good length and outside off, Warner brings out a smart late-cut. Hit to third man
Henry to Smith, no run shortish and outside off, check-pushed towards the cover-point region
Santner to Warner, no run good length on middle, clipped to midwicket
Santner to Warner, no run slides on middle, not that short, backs away and chops to Neesham at short third man
Santner to Warner, no run full, tossed up on middle, push-driven to mid-off
Santner to Warner, FOUR runs beats wide mid-off diving to his left. Tossed up, Warner twinkles down the track and drives it handsomely down the ground
Santner to Warner, 1 run worked off the pads through square leg
Santner to Smith, no run angled into the pads, tickled with the angle to short fine leg
Henry to Warner, FOUR runs hip-high short ball on off stump, Warner lays into it. Pulling it in the air over midwicket on the front foot
Henry to Warner, no run full and outside off, square-driven to Guptill at point
Henry to Warner, no run just short of a good length and outside off, swatted with a flat bat to mid-on
Henry to Warner, no run back of a length and outside off, punched to the right of extra cover, and to the left of Guptill at point
Henry to Warner, FOUR runs short and outside off, Warner unleashes another powerful pull. This time he pivots on the back foot and smashes it in the air to the left of midwicket
Henry to Warner, 1 run much fuller and outside off, crisply driven to extra cover
Santner to Warner, no run flighted on middle, played back to the bowler
Santner to Warner, 1 run tucked off the pads through square leg

Santner to Smith, FOUR runs short and turning away, chopped away wide of backward point, Trent Boult runs across to his right. Stumbles, slides, and his foot was in contact with the ad boards while pulling the ball in
Santner to Smith, 1 run looped up outside off, driven more or less straight to sweeper cover
Santner to Warner, no run length ball, pushed into the covers
Santner to Warner, 1 run down the track and driven down to long-on
de Grandhomme to Warner, no run good length and angled in, worked to midwicket
de Grandhomme to Warner, 1 run floated up on middle, driven along the ground to wide long-off
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run hip-high short ball on off, Smith pulls early and bottom-edges it to square leg
de Grandhomme to Warner, FOUR runs and Warner beats Henry again, this time to his right from long leg. Just short of a good length and outside off, chopped away fine of long leg
de Grandhomme to Warner, 1 run too straight in line, flicked to deep midwicket
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run pitched up and outside off, fluently driven to deep cover
Santner to Smith, 1 run back of a length and angled in, clipped to midwicket
Santner to Warner, 1 run short and outside off, forced away to deep point
Santner to Smith, no run back of a length and angled in, stands tall and punches it to mid-on
Santner to Smith, 1 run nice and full outside off, eased to deep cover
Santner to Warner, 1 run tickled off the pads, short fine leg (Southee) dives to his right to stop the ball
Santner to Smith, no run good length and angled in, worked to square leg. Good spell from Santner: 10-0-47-1
de Grandhomme to Warner, 2 runs back of a length and outside off, Warner aims a late-cut, the ball grazes the outside edge and rolls to third man
de Grandhomme to Warner, no run back of a length and outside off, punched to point
de Grandhomme to Warner, FOUR runs driven with laser-guided precision. Beats extra cover to his left and mid-off to his right. Sublime placement. Floated full and outside off, caressed
de Grandhomme to Warner, no run back of a length and outside off, glided to point
de Grandhomme to Warner, 1 run tucked off the pads through square leg
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run back of a length and outside off, helped down to third man with an angled bat
Neesham to Smith, FOUR runs full on the pads, flicked with an air of disdain. Split deep square and fine leg perfectly. Big boundary there, but it didn't matter.
Neesham to Smith, 2 runs width and he's crashed that behind point. Top class effort from Latham to run around at least 20 yards to his right and throw himself full stretch to stop that. Saved two
Neesham to Smith, 1 run punched on the up sweeper cover
Neesham to Warner, FOUR runs that's a hit! Wow, straight as a dye. The bowler had no time to even put his foot out. Such ferocity in his batting. Too full and he gave it the treatment.
Neesham to Warner, no run full and tailing away from middle, squeezed back down the pitch
Neesham to Warner, 1 run eased down to long-on, briefly thought of a second but he hit that too well.
Southee to Warner, no run slower and fuller on the pads, Warner misses a faint tickle to get him through to the century. Deflects off the pad to the keeper
Southee to Warner, no run looks to flay that through cover, gets it off the bottom of the bat and to the man on the edge of the ring. Cry of anguish as he executed the stroke

Southee to Warner, 1 run slower delivery on off, squeeze back down the pitch to get to the hundred. There's a typical leap, the joy is writ large on his face. His third hundred in five ODI innings. Can he convert this into a daddy hundred?
Southee to Smith, 1 run short and wide outside off, eased behind point as they jog the single
Southee to Warner, no run doesn't get the placement right this time. Slow off-cutter that has been hit straight to cover point
Southee to Warner, no run play and a miss. Not much width to play the cut. That kept a touch low as well and went through.
de Grandhomme to Smith, no run dabs a length ball on off towards short third man
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run forced off the backfoot to sweeper cover
de Grandhomme to Warner, 1 run worked off his pads wide of midwicket for a quick single
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run delicate little late dab to third man
de Grandhomme to Warner, 1 run angles a length ball into middle and leg, tucked between midwicket and square leg
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run uppish but into the gap, gets it down to sweeper cover. There's a half-century for the skipper. Muted celebration.
Southee to Smith, 1 run gets a thick inside edge that flies past leg stump and down to third man
Southee to Warner, 1 run gets in position early and pulls the short ball to deep square leg

Southee to Smith, no run the length ball nips back in from outside off, Smith played outside the line as he looked to ease it behind point. The ball missed everything. The appeal wasn't spontaneous either, and in the end, the right call has been made. No under-edge. Smith survives and rightly so
Southee to Smith, FOUR runs this has been clobbered over wide mid-on. Clears his front leg, and lofts the length ball over the infield without much fuss.
Southee to Smith, 1 run punched to deep cover as they pick an easy single again

Southee to Warner, FOUR runs poor effort from Matt Henry at third man. Dives full length but the timing is such that he had no chance despite that. Too full and wide, Warner did well to reach out and pick the bones out of that. Super placement
de Grandhomme to Smith, no run nips back in to hit him on the box. He went outside the line of the stumps to pull that behind square. He seems to be in some pain too and is flat on his back
de Grandhomme to Smith, no run went far too across to work that one away. The ball veered back in to hit him on the pad and deflect to the leg side

de Grandhomme to Smith, SIX runs clobbered into cow corner, 20 rows back, maybe 25. Went across the stumps and swung through cleanly to get the elevation and distance. Hoisted away with a touch of arrogance
de Grandhomme to Smith, 2 runs fetches the pull from outside off, gets it into the gap between deep square and deep midwicket
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run too full outside off, squeezed to deep point
de Grandhomme to Warner, 1 run makes room and bunts it wide of cover for a quick single

Boult to Warner, SIX runs Boult floated this in at 135 clicks, it went to the deep midwicket fence at double that speed! One heck of a shot. Warner fetches the full ball from outside off and swings across the line. Super stuff.
Boult to Warner, no run too full outside off, squeezed to cover

Boult to Warner, FOUR runs low full toss on the pads, tickled into the fine leg boundary. Buffet bowling this, as Geoff Boycott would say. All he had to do to get a boundary was a faint deflection, which he did.
Boult to Warner, no run this one's full and straight on off stump, pushed to cover
Boult to Warner, no run beaten by pace. Looked to angle that length ball behind point but was late on the shot
Boult to Warner, 1 run pulled towards midwicket, not timed well but enough to get a single

de Grandhomme to Warner, OUT the party's over. Good, low catch from Williamson at cover. This was full, Warner backed away and drilled it inside-out. Williamson stayed low and moved forward swiftly to take it inches from the ground. Applause, salutes for Warner. Super catch to end a super knock. Warner
de Grandhomme to Head, no run beaten by a delivery that nibbles away from middle
de Grandhomme to Head, 1 run hint of width, he opens the bat face late to steer it fine to third man
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 wide overbalanced but this was full and sliding down leg. Easy call for Paul Wilson
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run pulled from outside off towards deep midwicket
de Grandhomme to Head, 1 run leading edge but falls short of mid-off, they sneak in a run though
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 run wristy little flick down to long-on
Boult to Smith, 1 leg bye hit high on the thigh pad as he looks to work it off his hip, they take a run off the deflection
Boult to Head, 3 runs super timing. The power of the bottom-hand. Flicks that superbly between midwicket and mid-on
Boult to Smith, 1 run whipped with the angle towards midwicket for a quick single
Boult to Head, 1 run gets across the stumps and whips it uppishly towards square leg
Boult to Smith, FOUR runs digs one in short but Smith inside the line and helps it into the gap at fine leg. Easy pickings
Boult to Smith, 4 leg byes down leg and it's tickled into the fine leg boundary again. Was there some pad? This one was drifting down, Smith hopped across and tickled it away fine.
de Grandhomme to Head, FOUR runs Head's time to come to the party. Backs away and slaps that over the infield. The width was there and he muscled that away.

de Grandhomme to Head, SIX runs clean strike and a massive hit! Bleeding runs suddenly. Too full and angling into middle, Head stays inside the crease and slugs it over midwicket. Short boundary that side too
de Grandhomme to Head, 1 run can't get any bat on that flick, deflects off the pad to the leg side as they steal a single
de Grandhomme to Smith, 1 leg bye

de Grandhomme to Head, FOUR runs backs away and hammers it down the ground. The ball had passed the bowler even before he could react. Mid-off was inside the ring, so once it went past the bowler, it was four all the way. Sparkling batting this from the new batsman
de Grandhomme to Head, no run cuts, but finds backward point

Southee to Smith, OUT as easy as they come for Santner. This was a length ball outside off, Smith went across to play an agricultural heave but only managed to get the outside part of the bat to slice it to deep point. Not even the possibility of another century deterred him from playing his shots. End
Southee to Head, 2 runs crashed towards square third man. It was full and angling away, he opened the bat face late as he powered that away
Southee to Head, 1 run gets a thick edge this time as he looks to cut, on the bounce to third man
Southee to Marsh, no run right into the blockhole, manages to squeeze it out. There was half a shout for lbw but the ball would have missed leg stump. There was an inside edge too
Southee to Marsh, 1 wide gets the radar wrong, this one slips down the leg side. Southee appealed for caught behind. They've reviewed the decision, but there's no bat
Southee to Marsh, no run the bottom of his bat chips off as he digs out an inswinging yorker.
Southee to Marsh, no run yorker-length delivery on off, squeezed back to Southee who times his jump well to stop that

Henry to Head, FOUR runs full and outside off, Head clears his front leg and hoists it down the ground, straight of long-off. Neesham over-runs the ball to his left, and concedes a four. Another example of sloppy fielding from NZ
Henry to Head, no run pretty full on middle, Head bludgeons a drive to Williamson at extra cover. Marsh takes off, Head isn't keen on a single. Williamson can't effect a direct hit
Henry to Head, 1 run off-stump yorker, dug out to wide long-off
Henry to Marsh, 1 run low full-toss on off, pushed down to long-on, as Marsh gets off the mark after four balls

Henry to Head, (no ball) 1 run high full-toss outside off, umpire Dharmasena from square leg deems it a no-ball, above the waist. Outside off, Head gets forward, and slices a catch to extra cover. They go to the TV umpire, who confirms it was over waist-height. Umpire Wilson signals a free-hit
Henry to Marsh, (no ball) FOUR runs front-foot no-ball now. Tight call. Length and outside off, Marsh looks to smite it over the leg side, sends a thick outside edge flying to third man
Henry to Marsh, 1 run hacked away to short fine leg leg off the inside half
Henry to Head, no run full and angling away on a set of stumps outside off or even wider, Head has a wild swish at it and does not make contact
Southee to Marsh, 1 run pretty full and outside off, Marsh goes very hard at the ball, loses his shape, and toe-ends a jab down to long-on
Southee to Head, FOUR runs clears mid-on. Good length and outside off, slower cutter, swung off the bottom part of the bat over mid-on
Southee to Head, no run Southee rolls his fingers across another cutter, 115ks, Head slashes early and misses
Southee to Head, 1 wide wild off-side wide
Southee to Head, 1 run dances out, leans back and swings, and carves an outside edge wide of backward point
Southee to Marsh, 1 run very full on off, squeezed off the toe end to deep midwicket
Southee to Head, 1 run steps out, manufactures a full-toss, aims the covers, and ends up slicing it down to third man
Henry to Marsh, 1 run very full on middle, whipped to cow corner
Henry to Wade, no run yorker on off or just outside off, squirted back to the bowler
Henry to Wade, 1 run full and outside off, hit down to long-off
Henry to Marsh, SIX runs full ball on off, Marsh sizes it up, stays back and blasts it over long-off
Henry to Marsh, 1 run very full on middle, whipped to Santner at long-on
Henry to Wade, FOUR runs back of a length and outside off, pulled in the air over midwicket
de Grandhomme to Marsh, no run slower short ball, 110ks, offcutter, slogs early and is hoodwinked
de Grandhomme to Marsh, no run follows the cutter with a yorker on off, jammed back to the bowler
de Grandhomme to Marsh, no run another slower short ball outside off, Marsh does not pick it again. Slogs blindly and does not make contact
de Grandhomme to Marsh, SIX runs Marsh picks this full-toss up and puts it over long-on. Caught in the crowd. Low full-toss on off, Marsh smites it down the ground
de Grandhomme to Marsh, no run cutter, slower one floats past the leg stump as Marsh does not connect with the slog
de Grandhomme to Marsh, (no ball) 1 run full-toss over the waist, slower ball, pulled away to deep square leg
de Grandhomme to Wade, SIX runs 114.3ks slower short one outside off, Wade was sitting back, waiting for it. Muscles it over the midwicket boundary
Boult to Head, 1 run full on middle, belted to Williamson at mid-off
Boult to Marsh, 1 run pushed to mid-off for a risky single. A direct hit from de Grandhomme could have had Marsh at the non-striker's end
Boult to Head, 1 run full on middle and leg, clears his front leg and clubs it with a cross bat to long-on

Boult to Marsh, no run inswinging yorker, ends on leg stump, Marsh is late to bring his bat down. Off the pad and rolls to the covers. Head now is keen on a risky single. Marsh stays put. Boult runs across to his left. Attempts a back-handed flick, can't hit the stumps
Boult to Marsh, 2 runs very full on the stumps, jammed down to fine leg. The fielder runs in and collects the ball. Marsh chances the second and completes it. NZ needed a direct hit here too
Boult to Marsh, no run wide yorker outside off, Marsh loses his shape as he aims to reach out. He falls over and is beaten
Southee to Head, 1 run jabbed to the covers for one
Southee to Marsh, no run Marsh backs away outside leg, the bowler follows him with a yorker. Dug back to the bowler
Southee to Marsh, 1 run Marsh moves away outside leg again, Southee chases him and nails another yorker again. Pins him on his toes. Inside-edged. Impressive bowling
Southee to Head, FOUR runs length ball outside off to Head, he crashes a drive down the ground. Williamson throws himself to his left from wide mid-off, but is beaten
Southee to Head, 1 run overpitched and outside off, clears his front leg and violently drives the ball to deep cover
Southee to Marsh, 2 runs full on the stumps, whipped away to deep midwicket, on the bounce to the fielder
Boult to Marsh, 2 runs full on the leg stump, powered away between deep midwicket and long-on
Boult to Marsh, 2 runs yorker on off, shovelled away to long-on. Marsh hares across for the second. Australia get to 350
Boult to Marsh, SIX runs Marsh gets to a fifty off 33 balls. He races down the track, looks like a slower ball, bludgeoned over cow corner for a massive, massive six
Boult to Marsh, 1 run short and wide outside off, carved away to deep point
Boult to Wade, OUT bowled'em. No celebration at all from NZ. Good length on middle, Wade eyes a cross-bat slog across the line. He does not touch it. Boult hits the stumps. Rare dot
Boult to Bailey, no run full and sliding outside leg, he can't tickle it away. Off the pad and floats into the gloves of Watling

Henry to Marsh, 2 runs full-toss on middle, whipped away to wide long-on. They chance a second. The throw isn't accurate enough. Bailey dives full-length and is home by the time Henry collects the ball and tips the bails off
Henry to Marsh, SIX runs half-volley on off, clears his front leg, and launches it over long-off for another monster six
Henry to Marsh, SIX runs full again on middle and leg, right in the swinging slot, Marsh goes down the ground again. This is pasted over long-on
Henry to Marsh, SIX runs six, six, six. Strike three. Poor ball. Overpitched on middle, Marsh simply blasts it over long-on, replicating the previous hit
Henry to Marsh, no run low full toss outside off, Marsh reaches out but can't connect. Past the tramline, Southee gets away
Henry to Marsh, 1 run full and on off, Marsh eyes up the big slog again, can only manage an inside-edge onto the pad. The ball rolls towards cover.

6.20pm Australia have plundered 126 runs in the last 10 overs to run up 378 for 5, the second-highest total at the Manuka Oval. Warner, who struck his sixth ODI century of the year, and Smith, who made 72, set a strong base for the hosts. Head and Marsh then launched from there, scoring brutal half-centuries.
Welcome back. Here's Mitch Starc.
Starc to Guptill, no run starts off with a high full toss on middle, pushed to the off side

Starc to Guptill, no run big appeal for lbw. Possibly, pad first? They decide against a review. The ball bends back in to beat him on the forward prod. The line was good, but there was some bat involved too. Good decision from Kumar Dharmasena
Starc to Guptill, FOUR runs beats cover and point. Sublime timing. Just an extension of the arms as he powers the length ball into the gap. Superb timing.

Starc to Guptill, FOUR runs crunching cover drive on the up. Nothing wrong with the delivery. If someone hits you through the infield like that, just stand up and applaud. Nice, high elbow, perfect balance. Delightful
Starc to Guptill, 3 runs another one that threads the infield, Warner and Smith give it chase and pull it back in the nick of time.
Starc to Latham, no run defends that length ball on middle from the crease
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run full and swinging away from outside off, driven firmly to cover
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run invites the drive by pitching this up full outside off, left alone

Hazlewood to Guptill, FOUR runs crashes it into the point boundary at the rate of knots. Sehwag would be proud of that! Key to playing that was picking the length early, which he did. Intent from Guptill
Hazlewood to Guptill, SIX runs flicked imperiously into the deep midwicket boundary! This was a delicious leg-stump half-volley that got the treatment it deserved. He's raced away like a bullet train
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run punched back to the bowler
Hazlewood to Guptill, 1 run straight drive that could have been four if not for the bowler, who got a hand on it on his followthrough
Starc to Guptill, no run firm push on the up to mid-off. Planted his front foot forward to play that stroke
Starc to Guptill, 1 run uppish but down to third man. Backed away to cut but was cramped for room
Starc to Latham, 1 wide full and sliding down leg, Latham misses a faint little tickle. Scoring opportunity missed. Wide called
Starc to Latham, no run solid defense. Gets half-forward and dabs that length ball gently to the off side
Starc to Latham, no run leans into the drive, plays it well but can't pick the gap. Straight to cover
Starc to Latham, no run gets on top of the bounce and defends it back down the pitch
Starc to Latham, no run rip roaring bouncer outside off, Latham does well to sway out of the way
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run rapped on the glove as the ball falls short of gully. Did well to take the glove off the bat handle as he hopped to defend. The ball reared up from length
Hazlewood to Guptill, 1 wide angles back in to whizz past the thigh pad. Some exercise for the umpire
Hazlewood to Guptill, 1 run gets on top of the bounce and turns it to the leg side as they scamper a single.
Hazlewood to Latham, 1 run gets a thick inside edge toward square leg as he shapes to drive. The ball deviated back in ever-so-slightly
Hazlewood to Guptill, no run solid defense to that short of length delivery outside off
Hazlewood to Guptill, FOUR runs
Hazlewood to Guptill, 1 run leading edge but safe. Just short of the man coming in from short cover. They sneak in a run though.
Starc to Guptill, 1 run back of length delivery on middle and leg, he gets onto his toes and tucks it towards square leg for a quick single
Starc to Latham, no run firm push but straight to cover

Starc to Latham, 3 runs feeding him to his strengths. A length ball on middle and leg, chipped over midwicket. Didn't get the kind of timing he would have liked. Excellent running nevertheless to come back for three
Starc to Guptill, no run gets half-forward and eases that short of length delivery to point
Starc to Guptill, no run hurries him with a 143 clicks ball that snakes back in to have him hopping, pushed to cover
Starc to Guptill, FOUR runs backs away and lofts him over the infield. Not quite off the middle but splits mid-off and mid-on.
Hazlewood to Latham, no run not much room to work with, defends that away-going length ball to the off side
Hazlewood to Latham, no run gets forward and stabs that one away towards point
Hazlewood to Latham, no run once again can't find the gap, angles the length ball towards point
Hazlewood to Williamson, 1 run works the incoming short of length delivery on middle and leg towards fine leg

Hazlewood to Guptill, 1 run whipped off his hip towards the man coming in from deep square, the throw went to the wrong end, but overthrows at the bowler's end means there's no damage done. Williamson was nearly halfway down the pitch when he had to turn back
Cummins to Guptill, no run starts off with a yorker length delivery outside off, squeezed to cover
Cummins to Guptill, FOUR runs has he broken his bat? It was full and he crashes that past mid-off. Geez, that was nowhere near the middle but it still travelled
Cummins to Guptill, FOUR runs just a hint of width and he's hit that on the rise again. Free flow of the bat as it comes down nicely. He's really timing them sweetly
Cummins to Guptill, no run another cracking sound off the wood as he defended that to mid-off. Phew
Cummins to Guptill, no run thumped down the ground but straight to mid-off again
Cummins to Guptill, 1 run sliding into the pads, worked to deep square
Hazlewood to Guptill, 1 run whipped off his hip towards deep square
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run excellent delivery that. Nips away off the seam from the length area outside off, left alone
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run nearly chopped back onto the stumps. Half-hearted push to a delivery that wasn't too far away from off stump. Bounced wide
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run gets forward and defends that incoming full delivery with a straight bat
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run gets this one to jag back in off the deck from outside off, left alone
Hazlewood to Williamson, no run firm push but straight to mid-off
Cummins to Guptill, no run shows the full face of the bat to defend that incoming short of length delivery
Cummins to Guptill, no run stands tall and punches that to short cover

Cummins to Guptill, OUT beautiful delivery! Pat Cummins with a huge wicket with a delivery that had serious pace. 148.6kph . This one was full, it came back in from wide of the crease and then held its line as Guptill's poke took the thinnest of edges on the way through to Wade. Special ball that.
Cummins to Neesham, no run angles a length ball across Neesham, who gets on top of the bounce an dabs to the off side
Cummins to Neesham, 1 run thick edge that runs down to third man
Cummins to Williamson, no run eased down the ground, but straight to mid-on
Hazlewood to Neesham, no run this one's floated a touch ahead of the length area on middle, he deadbats that
Hazlewood to Neesham, no run pushed back to the bowler again, this was much fuller. Neesham was better of playing forward rather than defending from the crease
Hazlewood to Neesham, no run pressure building. This one's full on off, pushed to short cover
Hazlewood to Neesham, no run excellent bouncer, this one on middle and leg, Neesham ducks under it
Hazlewood to Neesham, no run shows the full face of the bat in defense
Hazlewood to Neesham, no run driven, but straight to Finch at cover point
Cummins to Williamson, no run back of a length on middle, worked on the back foot to midwicket
Cummins to Williamson, 1 run back of a length and outside off, opens the face and runs the ball to third man

Cummins to Neesham, 1 run good length on off, 147ks, Neesham hangs back and dabs it gently to the midwicket region. Cummins runs across, tracks it down, spins around, but misses a direct hit. Not by much. Neesham was struggling there
Cummins to Williamson, 1 run back of a length and straight in line, clipped away through square leg
Cummins to Neesham, no run 144ks bouncer on leg, ducks under it
Cummins to Neesham, 2 runs clipped off the pads square through the leg side
Head to Williamson, no run short on middle, hangs back and punches straight to midwicket
Head to Williamson, 1 run similar ball, punched to the left of midwicket
Head to Neesham, no run Head is firing it in, Neesham camps back and pushes to midwicket
Head to Neesham, 1 run shorter on middle, forced on the back foot to long-on
Head to Williamson, 1 run late-cut away to the left of point
Head to Neesham, 1 run dropped short and outside off, cut away to the right of Warner at sweeper cover
Cummins to Neesham, no run short on off, 145.2ks, fended back to the bowler
Cummins to Neesham, no run bouncer angling away outside off, 144.5ks, bursts past the hook. Wade leaps and gloves it over his head
Cummins to Neesham, no run back of a length and angling across off, stabbed to the covers

Cummins to Neesham, FOUR runs back of a length and outside off, Neesham stands tall and hits through the line. Punched away on the up between extra cover and point. First boundary by a NZ batsman other than Guptill
Cummins to Neesham, 1 wide Cummins replies with a fiery bumper on middle, Neesham ducks late. Wade jumps and gloves it with one hand. Wide
Cummins to Neesham, 1 run back of a length and outside off, punched uppishly in the off-side gap
Cummins to Williamson, no run back of a length and outside off, opens the face and jabs to point
Head to Neesham, no run slider on off, poked towards point on the back foot
Head to Neesham, 1 run darted short and outside off, flat-batted away to long-on
Head to Williamson, 1 run whipped off the pads to square leg, where the fielder dives to his right, and takes some pace off the ball
Head to Neesham, no run speared into the pads, Neesham misses the flick. Might have inside-edged onto the pad
Head to Neesham, no run non-turning short ball, whipped on the back foot to midwicket
Head to Neesham, 1 run keeps it short, punched down to long-on
Cummins to Neesham, 1 run back of a length and angling away outside off, 147ks, run down to third man
Cummins to Williamson, no run back of a length and outside off, punched to point, diving save
Cummins to Williamson, no run nearly chopped on. Good length and on off, cross-seamer Williamson plays late, too late this time. Inside-edge bounces over off stump
Cummins to Williamson, no run stabbed into the off side
Cummins to Williamson, no run short and wide outside off, 146.2ks, Williamson can't find the gap, can't turn the strike. Cut straight to backward point
Cummins to Williamson, no run pitched up and outside off, driven on the up, but straight to extra cover
Head to Neesham, no run tossed up outside off, guided to short third man
Head to Neesham, 1 run short and speared in on middle, 94ks, hangs back and punches down to long-off
Head to Williamson, 1 run slides on off from around the stumps, back-foot force to long-on
Head to Neesham, 1 run short and skids on middle, punched to long-on again
Head to Williamson, 1 run fuller on the pads, flicked away to deep midwicket
Head to Neesham, no run straight roller on a fourth-stump line, opens the face and dabs the ball to point
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run full around off, clipped to deep midwicket
Faulkner to Neesham, 1 run back of a length and outside off, crisply punched to sweeper cover

Faulkner to Williamson, SIX runs shot. Williamson needed this breathing space. NZ needed this breathing space. Full on off stump, hits through the line. Held the elbow up and lofted beautifully over mid-off
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run nurdled to the right of mid-on
Faulkner to Neesham, no run back of a length, punched to mid-on
Faulkner to Neesham, 1 run back of the hand slower ball outside off, font size=72, Neesham does not pick it. Throws his bat at a drive, does so early, skewing an outside edge to third man
Head to Neesham, no run skids on off, flat and speared in, whipped to midwicket
Head to Neesham, no run short and outside off, swiped away to midwicket again
Head to Neesham, no run much slower on off stump, skewed off the inside half to midwicket. Three dots, and the pressure builds on NZ again
Head to Neesham, 1 run tossed on middle, driven to the right of midwicket now
Head to Williamson, no run slides on off, worked straight to midwicket
Head to Williamson, no run pitched up on the stumps, played back to the bowler
Faulkner to Neesham, 1 run back of a length and on the pads, clipped on the back foot to midwicket
Faulkner to Williamson, no run full and slanting away outside off, Williamson, having shuffled across off, dabs to point
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run back of a length and outside off, steered to Hazlewood at third man
Faulkner to Neesham, 1 run short and wide outside off, slapped away to the right of sweeper
Faulkner to Williamson, no run back of a length and angling away outside off, chopped towards point

Faulkner to Williamson, FOUR runs and the rising asking rate forces Williamson to manufacture a shot. He runs down the track, and chips it over mid-on for only the third boundary since Guptill's exit in the ninth over
Head to Neesham, 1 run speared short on off, the left-hander can't come forward. Stays back and punches to long-on
Head to Williamson, no run full on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
Head to Williamson, 2 runs tossed up, Williamson backs away a touch and lifts it inside-out over mid-off
Head to Williamson, no run speared down leg, Williamson attempts a sweep, ends up gloving behind to the keeper. Could have been a wide
Head to Williamson, 1 run pushed outside leg again, Williamson goes low, pre-meditates a sweep, and finds long leg
Head to Neesham, 1 run whipped away to deep midwicket
Faulkner to Neesham, 2 runs slower delivery outside off, Neesham picks it. Waits for the ball to arrive and lofts it in the air between extra cover and mid-off

Faulkner to Neesham, 2 runs back of a length on off, flicked through the vacant spaces at midwicket. Warner stumbles a bit on the throw, sends the ball to the keeper's end, could have thrown to Williamson's end
Faulkner to Neesham, no run full and outside off, slower from the back of the hand at 114ks, poked off an outside edge to point
Faulkner to Neesham, no run back of a length and outside off, steered off the face to short third man
Faulkner to Neesham, FOUR runs full and outside off, 110.7ks, hoicked away in the air over midwicket
Faulkner to Neesham, no run short of a length on middle, goes back and runs the ball to point
Marsh to Williamson, no run good length on off, Williamson, blocked with a straight bat
Marsh to Williamson, 1 run back of a length and just outside off, Williamson shimmied out of the crease, but adjusts well. Plays late, opens the face, and secures a single down to third man
Marsh to Neesham, no run good length and angling away outside off, steered to backward point
Marsh to Neesham, 1 run good length and outside off, Neesham is through with the shot early against the slower ball. Chips the ball in front of long-on
Marsh to Williamson, FOUR runs good length and outside off, Williamson goes across the line. Slogs the ball over mid-on
Marsh to Williamson, 1 run back of a length and outside off, glides it neatly to third man
Faulkner to Williamson, FOUR runs short and wide outside off, played, Williamson. Skips back and unleashes a strong square-cut
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run now Williamson brings out the glide to third man
Faulkner to Neesham, no run full on off stump, pushed to point
Faulkner to Neesham, FOUR runs full and outside off, aims a crease-bound drive, and drags an inside edge fine on the leg side, past the stumps
Faulkner to Neesham, 1 run short and wide outside off, chops down to third man
Faulkner to Williamson, no run full and outside off, Williamson drives without any feet and is beaten on the outside
Marsh to Neesham, no run full and just a shade outside off, the bat turns in the hands of Neesham. Wafted back to Marsh
Marsh to Neesham, no run back of a length on middle, played back to the bowler
Marsh to Neesham, 2 runs full and wide outside off, driven with plenty of bottom hand to the right of extra cover
Marsh to Neesham, no run short ball on off, Neesham pulls. Tries to over-hit it and loses his shape. Ends up flapping the ball to square leg
Marsh to Neesham, FOUR runs bang! Neesham succeeds in pulling this. Dragged short and outside off, hammered away to the right of Finch at deep square leg. That exploded from the middle of the bat
Marsh to Neesham, no run back of a length and Marsh runs this across the left-hander, past the outside edge
Starc to Williamson, 2 runs glanced down to fine leg
Starc to Williamson, no run short and wide outside off, Williamson reaches out for a wild slash and misses
Starc to Williamson, no run yorker, speared in on off, from around the wicket. Jammed back
Starc to Williamson, no run pitched up and outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
Starc to Williamson, 1 run very full and outside off, guided down to third man
Starc to Neesham, 1 run full and outside off, almost 148ks, dabbed wide of backward point
Marsh to Neesham, 1 run short and kicks up outside off, Neesham gets on top of the bounce and cuts powerfully to sweeper cover
Marsh to Williamson, 1 run finesse from Williamson. Employs the latest of late cuts. Played from outside off to third man
Marsh to Neesham, FOUR runs driven in the air to the left of mid-off. Good length and outside off, Neesham simply hits through the line. It's that kind of a pitch

Marsh to Neesham, SIX runs hip-high short ball outside off, Neesham lays into it. Pulls it flat and hard over square leg, Finch had no chance running to his left from deep midwicket. Neesham acknowledges his fifty
Marsh to Neesham, no run back of a length and angling away outside off, crunched straight to mid-off
Marsh to Neesham, 1 run short on the hips, flicked away square through the leg side. Neesham wants two, but is sent back by his captain
Starc to Neesham, no run back of a length and swings back into the left-hander, raps him on the pad, Neesham plays across, and is beaten for pace. Sliding down leg, though. Tinge of reverse for Starc
Starc to Neesham, no run full-toss, swings away, pushed down to mid-off
Starc to Neesham, 1 run full and reverse-swings in, squirted to midwicket
Starc to Williamson, 1 run worked away to the right of midwicket

Starc to Neesham, no run Neesham looks away, takes his eyes off it, and is struck flush on the unprotected part on his right forearm, just below the elbow. 148ks thunderbolt from Starc, Neesham misjudges the bounce, and ducks on the front foot, ouch! He barely flinches, however. Fiery short one from St
Starc to Neesham, no run full inswinging yorker, 147ks, Neesham just about digs it out
Head to Williamson, 1 run low full-toss on middle from around the stumps, hit down to long-on
Head to Neesham, 1 run shorter on off, punched on the back foot to long-on
Head to Williamson, 3 runs flat and down leg, paddled fine past the keeper
Head to Neesham, no run Neesham skips out, Head adjusts his length. Short and speared on off. Fended
Head to Neesham, FOUR runs short and outside off, barely bail-high, pulled away to the cow corner fence
Starc to Williamson, 1 run short and angled in, absorbed the pace on it and turned to the right of midwicket. Just one
Starc to Neesham, 1 run full and outside off, nearly 149ks, driven to mid-off. Head can't throw the stumps down at the non-striker's end
Starc to Williamson, 1 run very full and outside off, Williamson angles it down to third man
Starc to Neesham, 1 run short of a length on off, hops and glides the ball down to third man
Starc to Williamson, 2 runs nice and full outside off, wristy drive to the left of extra cover
Starc to Williamson, no run good length and tails in on off, run away to backward point
Head to Neesham, no run glanced off the pads to fine leg
Head to Neesham, 1 run slog-swept away to deep midwicket, more off the inside half of the bat
Head to Williamson, 1 run slides across Williamson, late-cut to short third man for a quick single
Head to Neesham, 1 run slog-swept away to Finch at deep square leg again
Head to Williamson, 1 run fired into the pads, whipped away to deep square leg. Williamson gets to a fifty of his own
Head to Neesham, 1 run darted on middle, no turn, swept away square through the leg side
Hazlewood to Neesham, 1 run back of a length and outside off, flat-bats a cut to sweeper
Hazlewood to Williamson, 1 run full on middle and leg, nudged to the right of midwicket
Hazlewood to Neesham, FOUR runs dug short and outside off, Neesham unleashes another rasping pull. Tonked away over midwicket
Hazlewood to Neesham, 2 runs clipped off the hips through backward square leg for a couple
Hazlewood to Neesham, no run good length and angling away, played with soft hands to backward point

Hazlewood to Neesham, OUT Hazlewood returns and takes down Neesham. Good length and angling away outside off, from over the wicket, Neesham can't get under it as this isn't as full as he would have liked. Aims a loft, and ends up skewing a catch to Starc moving back from mid-off. Neesham falls for 74,
Faulkner to Munro, 1 run length and outside off, guided to sweeper cover
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run back of a length and outside off, back-foot force to deep point
Faulkner to Munro, no run length and outside off, driven to the covers
Faulkner to Munro, no run back of a length and outside off, punched to the covers
Faulkner to Munro, no run back of a length inducker, he aims to drive. Shoots through the gate. The ball bounces over the stumps

Faulkner to Munro, SIX runs full and outside off, right in the hitting slot. Neesham was looking for this length. Munro gets it and dispatches the ball over the long-off boundary. Clean swing through the line
Hazlewood to Williamson, 1 run full and angled in on off, whipped away to deep square leg
Hazlewood to Munro, no run back of a length, pitches on leg or just outside off, swings away, takes the outside edge and rolls to point
Hazlewood to Munro, no run back of a length on off, punched to cover
Hazlewood to Munro, FOUR runs short and angling away outside off, flashes and sends an outside edge to the left of lone slip
Hazlewood to Munro, no run back of a length on middle, stabbed to cover
Hazlewood to Munro, no run back of a length and swerving away, hops and fends to cover
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run back of a length and outside off, punched to the left of extra cover
Faulkner to Munro, no run short on middle, hops and fends
Faulkner to Williamson, 2 runs short and angled in, picked off the hips to long leg
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run length and outside off, leans back and glides to third man
Faulkner to de Grandhomme, no run full on off, kept out
Hazlewood to Williamson, 1 run full and outside off, opens the face and dabs to third man
Hazlewood to de Grandhomme, no run length ball on off, 140ks, reverses in a bit, pushed to mid-on
Hazlewood to de Grandhomme, no run back of a length and outside off, jabbed to point
Hazlewood to de Grandhomme, no run length ball snakes away outside off, past the outside edge
Hazlewood to de Grandhomme, no run full and breaks back into the right-hander, he falls over and inside-edges it onto his pad
Hazlewood to de Grandhomme, no run full, angled in, and then shapes away from de Grandhomme. He attempts a crease-bound drive and misses
Faulkner to Williamson, no run length and outside off, punched to mid-off
Faulkner to Williamson, no run Williamson steps out and shuffles outside leg, meets a short ball, and flat-bats it to extra cover
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run whipped from outside off over midwicket
Faulkner to de Grandhomme, no run short and angled in on off, opens the face and dabs the ball to backward point
Faulkner to de Grandhomme, SIX runs and he gets off the mark with a six after eight balls. The batsman clears Bailey. Back of a length and outside off, swung away
Faulkner to de Grandhomme, 2 runs back of the hand slower one outside off, chopped down towards third man
Cummins to Williamson, no run short on off, cramps him for room. Chopped to backward point
Cummins to Williamson, no run back of a length and angled in on off, defended with a straight bat
Cummins to Williamson, 2 runs slower cutter outside off, 122ks, Williamson shuffles across and shovel-paddles it over short fine leg
Cummins to Williamson, 1 run down the track and slices an outside edge to third man
Cummins to de Grandhomme, no run wide of the crease, and slanted it, raps the pad, and rolls away to square leg. It was definitely heading past the leg stump
Cummins to de Grandhomme, 2 runs short and outside off, late-cut to backward point, where Smith fumbles. He puts his hand up in apology right away
Faulkner to Williamson, 2 runs full and outside off, throws his hands at it and carves an outside edge to third man
Faulkner to Williamson, no run short on off, pulled straight to midwicket. Williamson looking to over-hit the ball
Faulkner to Williamson, FOUR runs Williamson pre-meditates, shuffles across off, takes it from outside off and paddles it fine of short fine leg. That's his first boundary since the 23rd over
Faulkner to Williamson, SIX runs follows it with a six. Back of a length on middle, heaved away over Cummins at deep square leg
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run slower short ball just outside off, chopped to short third man
Faulkner to de Grandhomme, no run back of the hand slower one outside off, Faulkner cuts this one across the right-hander. Wild slog-sweep and a miss

Starc to Williamson, FOUR runs full and holds its line outside off, backs away and lifts it in the air. Bailey at extra cover dives to his left, the ball bursts through his hands to the boundary. Replays show that Bailey had finger-tipped it away
Starc to Williamson, 1 run very full and angled in, driven down to mid-on
Starc to de Grandhomme, 2 runs low full-toss outside off, sliced past backward point

Starc to de Grandhomme, OUT edged and taken by Wade diving low to his right. Wide of the crease, very full and holds its line outside off. De Grandhomme does not move his feet, flashes a drive with his hands, and nicks behind. Excellent take from Wade
Starc to Santner, 1 wide yorker, swerves down leg, wide
Starc to Santner, 1 leg bye full-toss, tails into the pads, Santner is late to flick, and wears it on the top of the pad
Starc to Williamson, 1 run very full and angled in, dropped to the covers with soft hands
Cummins to Watling, no run Cummins greets him with a cross-seamer, rapid bouncer, ducks under it
Cummins to Watling, 1 run back of a length and outside off, forced to sweeper cover
Cummins to Santner, no run full on middle and leg, played back to the bowler
Cummins to Santner, 1 run short of a length on middle, punched to extra cover for a scampered single
Cummins to Watling, no run short and skids on off, 144ks, Wating throws his bat in front like a face-shield. Fended back
Starc to Santner, 1 run full on middle, driven on the front foot to long-on
Starc to Watling, no run full and holds its line outside off, Watling drives hard and misses
Starc to Watling, no run full and much wider outside off, Watling reaches out for a drive. Still can't make contact
Starc to Watling, 1 run Watling now succeeds in driving a full ball to deep covcer
Starc to Southee, 2 runs full on middle and leg, 148ks, hangs back and flicks to the right of mid-on
Cummins to Watling, FOUR runs back of length delivery outside off, he backs away, frees his arms and smears it over point, one bounce into the boundary
Cummins to Watling, 1 run uses the bowler's pace to glide it down to third man
Cummins to Southee, no run backs away to slash over point but the steep bounce did him in. The ball also kept coming back in to cramp him for room
Cummins to Southee, no run way too early into the pull, gets a bottom edge that goes through to Wade on the bounce

Cummins to Southee, OUT pace and bounce does the trick again. Southee was in no position to play a flat-batted pull. The ball got big on him, he was cramped for room and only managed to get a top edge to Bailey, who took a simple catch coming in from midwicket.
Cummins to Watling, 1 run chopped behind the wicket and they scamper a run
Starc to Watling, no run firm push off the frontfoot but straight to cover
Starc to Watling, 1 run swung across the line, gets the toe end but the ball lands short of the man running in from long-off
Starc to Henry, no run stands still inside the crease and pushes the length ball to mid-off

Starc to Henry, no run how did that miss the off stump? I don't know. This one's fired full and into the stumps from around the stumps, the batsman went for an almighty thwack but missed it completely
Starc to Henry, 1 run juicy full toss that has been slashed over the infield to deep cover
Starc to Watling, no run play and a miss. This was too close to cut, the ball shaves past the inside edge
Cummins to Henry, 2 runs slower and fuller outside off, swung across the line to toe-end it towards deep square
Cummins to Henry, 1 run off-cutter around the seventh stump, drags the slog from outside off towards midwicket. Didn't get it anywhere near the middle of the bat
Cummins to Watling, no run excellent bouncer but way over the batsman's head. Watling did well to spot that early and duck under it
Cummins to Watling, 1 run drilled down the ground but straight to Head at long-on
Cummins to Henry, no run backs away to go over cover, but gets it off the toe end to the fielder there
Cummins to Henry, no run swing and a miss. He looked to hit that to Sydney, but could only connect with the cool evening air. Went for a mow over cow corner but played too early
Starc to Watling, 1 run full-length delivery on off, driven to long-off
Starc to Henry, no run another swing and a miss. Backs away to slap that length ball over cover but he was nowhere near the ball
Starc to Henry, no run he can't lay bat on ball at the moment. Looks to swipe this over the infield, but the ball tails away late to beat his swing

Starc to Henry, no run three in a row. On another night, Starc would have shattered the stumps many times over. Floats this full and into the batsman from around the stumps, Henry swings over long-on but misses
Starc to Henry, 2 runs backs away and lofts this one into the gap at cover, two it will be
Starc to Henry, 1 run looks for a yorker but turns out to be a high full toss on the body, tucked wide of midwicket as they take a single

Cummins to Henry, OUT hit well, but he's picked out the lone man at deep midwicket. Swung through the line to pull that short delivery, but it was almost as if he forgot there was a man in the deep. Nice, running catch from Faulkner. Ran to his left, was aware of the boundary behind him and pouched it
Cummins to Watling, no run backs away and bunts an imcoming length ball to the off side
Cummins to Watling, 1 run mistimes a pull to deep midwicket. Watling wanted the second but Boult wouldn't have made it back
Cummins to Boult, no run right into the blockhole from wide of the crease, Boult just about manages to dig that out in the nick of time
Cummins to Boult, no run punched to point from the crease
Cummins to Boult, 1 run no, he can't. Excellent slower ball on middle, Boult gets an inside edge to the leg side and gets off the mark

Hazlewood to Boult, 1 run swings and gets a thick inside edge towards the keeper. Watling was off the blocks, but Boult, who was ball-watching, had to really scamper through to make the crease even as the throw came whistling in to the bowler's end. A direct hit and he was gone.
Hazlewood to Watling, FOUR runs that's a lovely hit. Backs away and slap the length ball over extra cover. The bat face slightly turned in his hand, but he ensured there was enough power

Hazlewood to Watling, no run crunching drive, Boult was more than a couple of paces in for a run. Smith could have thrown it down at the bowler's end but he stopped short of doing that. May have cost Australia a run at max.
Hazlewood to Watling, 1 run walks across the stumps and swings leg side, gets a bottom edge towards short fine leg
Hazlewood to Boult, no run makes room and squeezes a yorker-length delivery to cover
Hazlewood to Boult, no run clears his front leg and clobbers that to mid-off, calls 'wait' immediately. Can't beat the infield
Faulkner to Watling, no run slower delivery angling away, flayed to the point fielder

Faulkner to Watling, OUT how fitting is it for Warner, the centurion, to take the catch? Australia have taken the Chappell-Hadlee series. Watling swings but doesn't get under that full delivery and ends up slicing it towards Warner, who circles around the ball briefly at cover, before settling undernea
That is all we have for you from this game. Thanks for reading. Cheers

10.20pm Australia have bounced back, and how. They lost 5-0 in the ODI series in South Africa. They came back home and were beaten 2-1 in the Tests. The seniors were under pressure here, but have they delivered or what? David Warner made a typically bruising century to set things up along with Steven Smith be
Australia won by 116 runs
Player of the match is David Warner, AUS
